page.title: 20HALMOSS FARM
page.content: Mr.Will,a farmer in Inverugie owns Halmoss Farm,and he kindly told us a bit about it.He has approx.250 head of cattle,about 80 of which produce milk.There are 65 acres of winter barley,20 of turnips,45 oil seed rape,105 wheat and 20 acres in fallow.Sometimes he keeps sheep,but at the time we interviewed him,he did not have any.It is mainly a dairy farm_ meat is only a by_product.When the milk leaves the farm,it goes to retail.It can be sold from the farm or it can go to a dry dairy or to the Milk Board,where it is made into butter,skimmed milk,cheese and many other dairy products.Because of sophisticated new machinery,there are now only 5 people employed on the farm,whereas a few years ago,there were 13.
